application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To carry out tree surgery to remove the lowest limb from two Oaks (T1 and T2 on application) and remove the two lowest limbs from one Oak (T3 on application), all within Area 1 on TPO 400
decision_conditions: One Oak (T1 on the application) is situated within the front garden of 36 Copse wood Way and has a High amenity value. The other two are situated within the rear garden and have a combined Moderate to high amenity value. Along with other nearby trees the Oaks help to provide a gradual transition of mature tree cover between the dwellings in Copsewood Way and the nearby Ruislip woods National Nature Reserve (NNR).
The trees contribute to local biodiversity, and significantly contribute to the amenity and arboreal / wooded character of the Copsewood Estate Area of Special Local Character.

The applicant's reason for completing the work is "Excessive shading" however it is unclear how the removal of a few select branches will make any difference to the overall level of shade from the trees. There is some ambiguity in exactly which limbs the applicant is referring to however it is believed that the removal of these will leave large wound within the tree's trunks which would likely cause str
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
